title: 656-B
statement: B. Yuo argee on tow arayrs of ientgres M adn R, nmebur upmicnog dyas (induiclng teh cunrret oen) wtih sicsescuve irnegets (teh ceurrnt dya is zreo), adn yuo wsah teh diehss on dya D if adn olny if terhe etsixs an iednx i scuh tahtDmodM[i] =R[i], otwsehrie yuor rmootmae deos it. Amsuse taht yuo hvae iiiftlneny mnay dyas aehad of yuo.InputThe first line of input contains a single integer N (1 ≤N≤ 16).The second and third lines of input contain N integers each, all between 0 and 16, inclusive, and represent arrays M and R, respectively. AllM[i]are positive, for eachiR[i] <M[i].OutputOutput a single real number. The answer is considered to be correct if its absolute or relative error does not exceed10- 4.ExamplesInput120Output0.500000Input22 31 0Output0.666667
